question: How is Aqua regia formed?
option1: by mixing 2 parts of concentrated HCl and one part of concentrated HNO<sub>3</sub>
option2: by mixing 3 parts of concentrated HCl and one part of concentrated HNO<sub>3</sub>
option3: by mixing 1 part of concentrated HCl and three parts of concentrated HNO<sub>3</sub>
answer: by mixing 3 parts of concentrated HCl and one part of concentrated HNO<sub>3</sub>
explanation: When three parts of concentrated HCl and one part of concentrated HNO<sub>3</sub> are mixed, aqua regia is formed which is used for dissolving noble metals, e.g., gold, platinum.
